traceability.evidence:
The code does implement npm view time via fetchVersionTimes and age calculation via calculateAgeInDays, and the CLI prints a single “Age (days)” column for each package. However:
1. Smart‐fetching optimization is missing: fetchVersionTimes always calls `npm view time --json` and returns *all* version timestamps—there is no logic to fetch or even drop versions older than the current version.
2. The UI only ever shows the age of the latest version (one number per package). The spec calls for fetching and displaying ages for *all* newer versions.
No tests or code paths implement the filtering or per‐version display required by the story’s acceptance criteria for smart fetching and full version‐age listing.
traceability.notes: Core fetch and age‐calc functions exist and are wired into the CLI, but the optimization and multi‐version age display requirements have not been implemented.
